May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.
BOARD OF VISITORS. CHAPMAN JOHNSON, Rector. JOSEPH C. CABELL, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOHN H. COCKE, THOMAS JEFF. RANDOLPH. JAMES M. MASON. WM. C. RIVES, SAMUEL TAYLOR. Secretary of the Board, FRANK CARR.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. Chairman of the Faculty. JOHN A. G. DAVIS (to Nov. 14, 1840.) GESSNER HARRISON. GESSNER HARRISON, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. W. BLÆTTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. J. J. SYLVESTER, Professor of Mathematics. WM. B. ROGERS, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry and Mat. Med. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. HENRY HOWARD, Professor of Physiology, Medicine, Obstetrics and Medical Jurisprudence. JOHN A. G. DAVIS, NAT. P. HOWARD, Professors of Law. JAMES L. CABELL, Professor of Anatomy and Surgery. WILLIAM WERTENBAKER, Librarian and Secretary of the Faculty. WILLIS H. WOODLEY, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar. Rev. WM. S. WHITE, Chaplain.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. SEVENTEENTH SESSION.—1840-1841. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L.— Ancient Languages. M. L.— Modern Languages. M.— Mathematics. N. P.— Natural Philosophy. C. E.— Civil Engineer. C.— Chemistry. M. P.— Moral Philosophy. MED.— Medicine. A. &S.— Anatomy &Surgery. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. SES. Abell, George W. Albemarle co., Va. A L, C, M P, 2 Anderson, Wm. L.
